basic_data.name: Via Rail Business Lounge Union Station

reviews.title: Ok
text: Pretty basic compared with airline lounges. They do have  decent juices and soda pop cans. Also coffee machine … which is ok unless you are a coffee snob. The seats are comfortable enough to wait for your train

reviews.title: Great way to start a trip
text: Very comfortable and handily located business lounge.
Basic but adequate beverage options.
Super friendly check in staff.
Great way to start a trip

reviews.title: Easy to Skip
text: Not up to the standard being offered in the TD Lounge across the hall. Tired facility with very limited offering. Other than for being a place to sit while you wait for your train, not worth visiting.

reviews.title: Trains Trip between Montreal and Toronto
text: The business lounge is stocked with water and juices, coffee from a coffee machine. There may have been some fruit in a bowl. Lots of seating and TVs. I was greeted upon arrival and told that my train would be on the board. I did not hear any announcement about pre boarding but watched a few passengers leave the lounge. Just when I decided I may as well head down another passenger was doing the same. I followed her to come to the end of a long line. We waited briefly and then decided this can’t be right. Broke out of the lineup and paced down the entire station to arrive at the gate where pre boarding was almost complete. We made it. Then to find our right car was another bit of walk which ended with a huge step up onto the train with a few more steps inside. This was a challenge with the luggage. I was offered some assistance at this point. Getting off the train in Montreal was much easier as they brought a small ramp to bridge this gap.

The train ride itself was very comfortable and spacious, I did have a single forward facing seat. The lunch was decent and the service was mostly attentive. Delicious beet salad and pasta dish. I was asked if I wanted to keep my glass for water when they cleared away the dishes. I agreed but they never came back to offer more water. In Montreal boarding was announced, big difference. Arrival in Toronto was confusing. After an escalator ride I found myself back up at the departure level while my partner waited in the arrivals area…… We did connect eventually.

I would travel by train again with ore awareness of things operate differently out of different stations. Lovely picture of the Royal York with reflections on the glass roof of the pedway Toronto Union Station.

reviews.title: Good spot to relax and wait
text: We weren't in the lounge that long, but we were welcomed warmly, and we enjoyed a cup of coffee in a comfortable, very nicely renovated room.  I particularly liked the way they maintained the style of the original waiting room, even though it contained modern amenities such as large-screen TVs.
We required help because of mobility problems, and the staff was kind, good humoured and efficient.  The positive experience continued on the train.

reviews.title: First Impressions
text: Upon arriving at the business lounge, I encountered a gentleman who just sat there silently until I slid my ticket under the window.  No greeting.  No enquiry about how my day was going...or even where I was going.  He simply told me my train was boarding and the platform. No smile. No "have a nice journey."  The lounge is where business travelers begin their journey, and where they will get their first impression about the service.  This should be the easiest thing to get right.

reviews.title: Excellent service
text: This was our first train ride in years, so glad we decided to go with business class, the station, shops and underground system is having major work done to it, so to be able to get a small quiet place was worth the extra cost. To have your luggage taken and loaded by the staff sorts out the struggle to do it yourself. Coffees, soft drinks and fruit are available as well as a comfy seat.

reviews.title: Horrible experience
text: The lounge was only a precursor to a VERY disappointing 4 night trip Vancouver to Toronto. The only positive thing I can say about this vacation(?!) was that the staff was pleasant.  The food was mediocre, the wine was subpar, the (prestige) cabin was claustrophobic.  So many opportunities were not met; announcements could have been made as to what lake you were looking at/what province we were in etc.  A lecture could have been provided that explained how the train operates/ what different signs meant etc.   This could have been enjoyable and for the outrageous price it should have been.  The mini bar was stocked with water not" your preferred beverages".  (I have nothing against water, but...)   To top everything else we arrived in Toronto at 11:40 NOT 2:30; we could have flown home that day and not have to stayed over.

reviews.title: Fascinating trip
text: When you arrive at the Toronto station do ensure your luggage meets the size criteria. If not, you will have to unpack the essentials into bags. Best advice is stick to very small essentials for the trip as there is limited space in the sleeper cabins.
The lounge area is great with complimentary refreshments. Staff very helpful before and after you board.

The train ride to from Vancouver to Toronto is amazing but beware it does not keep to any real timetable due to cargo trains having right of way first . We were 9 hours late … don’t book any afternoon or evening events! Train was great and the food and service very nice indeed. Worth the time and money . Great experience and met some wonderful people. Cabins cosy and do the job. No or very limited phone signal and no free internet service .

reviews.title: Pity they call it a business lounge
text: If this is what you pay extra for very disappointed. Hot drinks from a vending machine that was water flavored with either a coffee something or chocolate with perhaps milk????? Staff welcoming wasn’t a welcome just doing a job i guess they thought boring.

reviews.title: Prestige Lounge
text: Checked where this lounge was before we needed to check in for our 4 day rail journey on the Canadian to Vancouver.  When you enter  through the main entrance off Front Street  you go forward then turn right as thou you walking to catch the UPs train.  Look to your right and you will see the door to go in.

We found our check in very good, we were shepherded into the Prestige lounge  by a very helpful lady, greeted by one of the trains concierge, checked our details, took our cases and then offered some light refreshments and  non alcoholic drinks.
When we were ready to go to the train, we were escorted into the main station and onto the platform and onto the train.

reviews.title: Meh...
text: Last time I used the lounge was prepandemic. Nothing much has changed. Poorly greeted at arrival by a clerk who might as well work as a civil servant. No snacks, some cold drinks and coffee, poor choice of magazines.

reviews.title: No food
text: Just off the Great Hall, big lounge with plenty of seats. No snacks, just soft drinks and a coffee machine, some muted TVs.
Quiet place to wait for your Via train.
Windows look like they have not been washed in years.
7:45 am to 6:45 pm, but pandemic hours may vary.

reviews.title: Comfortable train business class VIP room
text: When taking Canadian Rail Business Class from Toronto Union Station, you can wait in this VIP lounge. There are many seats, spacious space, clean and quiet environment, and hot and cold drinks are provided, so that passengers can relax and take a break, or install computers and continue to deal with official business until the service staff informs them to go to the ticket gate to prepare for boarding, and enjoy priority ticket checking and the right to board trains.
